Authors: Aries, Vional, Saraswati L.A., Wijaya L., Ikhsan R.B.
Title: Gamification in learning process and its impact on entrepreneurial intention
Affiliations: Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Aries, Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Vional, Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Saraswati, L.A., Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Wijaya, L., Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Ikhsan, R.B., Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Gamification is an educational approach to motivate and influence students’ behaviors in learning with the intention of achieving learning outcomes. The primary objective of the study is to examine students’ intentions to become entrepreneurs as an impact of gamification model learning in Entrepreneurship or Business Plan courses in BINUS ONLINE Learning. Data collection was carried out for 400 students who took Entrepreneurship and Business Plan courses for 1 month using questionnaires. The data was then analyzed using multiple linear regression approach. The result shows that attitude towards behavior (ATB), perceived behavior control (PBS), and subjective norms partially give positive impacts and they are significant to entrepreneurial intentions. Perceived behavioral control (PBC) is the dominant factor in forming entrepreneurial intentions for students. © 2020 by the authors
Author Keywords: Entrepreneurial Intentions; Long Distance Learning Program; Planned Behavior

Authors: Ikhsan R.B., Saraswati L.A., Muchardie B.G., Vional, Susilo A.
Title: The determinants of students' perceived learning outcomes and satisfaction in BINUS online learning
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 5th International Conference on New Media Studies, CONMEDIA 2019
Affiliations: BINUS ONLINE Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ikhsan, R.B., BINUS ONLINE Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Saraswati, L.A., BINUS ONLINE Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Muchardie, B.G., BINUS ONLINE Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Vional, BINUS ONLINE Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Susilo, A., BINUS ONLINE Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The advancement of information technology and communication and the changing in education paradigm have influenced the process and method of learning. Online learning is one of the innovations for this recent changing paradigm. In this study, Structural Equation Modelling (SEM) is applied to examine the determinants of students' perceived learning outcomes and satisfaction in the context of university online course. Independent variables include instructor facilitation, technical support, course structure, instructor feedback, self-motivation, peer support, and interaction as potential determinants of online learning. A total of 400 BINUS Online Learning students were surveyed. The structural model result reveals that instructor facilitation, technical support, instructor feedback, and self-motivation affect the learning outcomes, and instructor facilitation, technical support, self-motivation, and peer support significantly affect the students' satisfaction. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Learning outcomes; Online learning; Students' perception; Students' satisfaction
Index Keywords: Education computing; Learning systems; Motivation; Students; Independent variables; Information technology and communications; Method of learning; Perceived learning outcomes; Structural equation modelling (SEM); Structural modeling; Students' satisfaction; Technical support; E-learning

Title: Production efficiency analysis for empowerment strategy of Troso weaving craft micro, small, and medium enterprises (SMEs) in Jepara Central Java
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Social Sciences and Humanities
Affiliations: Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9 Kemanggisan Palmerah, Jakarta Barat DKI Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ngatindriatun, Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9 Kemanggisan Palmerah, Jakarta Barat DKI Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Saraswati, L.A., Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9 Kemanggisan Palmerah, Jakarta Barat DKI Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hardiyansyah, Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9 Kemanggisan Palmerah, Jakarta Barat DKI Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Aries, Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9 Kemanggisan Palmerah, Jakarta Barat DKI Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This study attempts to analyse the business efficiency level of Troso weaving craft (tenun ikat or woven fabrics) of small and medium enterprises (SME) in Jepara, Central Java. In this research, a Data Envelopment Analysis (DEA) was used to obtain data from productive and unproductive SMEs. It analyses the value of technical efficiency and revenue efficiency of 41 Troso weaving craft SMEs with various business scales in Jepara. Results show that only 14 SMEs or 34% of the businesses were technically efficient. 50% of enterprises fulfilled the revenue efficiency. © Universiti Putra Malaysia Press.
Author Keywords: DEA; Production efficiency; SME; Troso weaving craft
